messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] learning different 13 yo girl and math
messages.msgSnippet: There s a website called algebra with legos. I don t have the URL but I m sure you could google it. Melissa Mom to Josh (11), Breanna (9), Emily (7), Rachel
messages.messageBody:
There's a website called algebra with legos. I don't have the URL but
I'm sure you could google it.

Melissa
Mom to Josh (11), Breanna (9), Emily (7), Rachel (6), Sam (5), Dan
(3), and Avari Rose

share our lives at
http://360.yahoo.com/multimomma




> "Algebra never made sense to me until
> someone showed me how it worked in a physical way (using blocks to
> show me how algebra was just completing sets to make whole figures all
> those x's and b's and a's were just the negative spaces)"
>
> .
>
>

messages.subject: learning different 13 yo girl and math
messages.msgSnippet: Algebra never made sense to me until someone showed me how it worked in a physical way (using blocks to show me how algebra was just completing sets to make
messages.messageBody:
"Algebra never made sense to me until
someone showed me how it worked in a physical way (using blocks to
show me how algebra was just completing sets to make whole figures all
those x's and b's and a's were just the negative spaces)"


The book "Algebra Unplugged" is supposed to be really great.

Ren
learninginfreedom.com
